title: ColorsHWB

metadata.description: Learn about ColorsHWB with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
HWB (Hue, Whiteness, Blackness) is a suggested standard for CSS4. HWB Calculator rgb(255, 0, 0) #ff0000 hsl(0, 100%, 50%) H: W: B: HTML Support HWB is not supported in HTML (yet), but it is suggested as a new standard in CSS4. While waiting for CSS4, you can include ' Color library, and use HWB as an HTML attribute like this: Example

London is the capital city of England. It is the most populous city in the United Kingdom, with a metropolitan area of over 13 million inhabitants.

Color Library The JavaScript library used in the example above can be downloaded from https://www..com/lib/w3color.js ★ +1

content_sections.code: London is the capital city of England. It is the most populous city in the United Kingdom, with a metropolitan area of over 13 million inhabitants.

summary: This tutorial covers ColorsHWB concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use ColorsHWB effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of ColorsHWB and how to apply it in your projects.
